perturbation.original_text: 8.1 Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company shall maintain in force, at all times during the Term and [*****], at its own costs and expenses, with insurers of internationally recognized reputation reasonably acceptable to the Repairer, insurances in accordance with industry standards with respect to the undertakings of the Company in Clause 15 ("Liability and Indemnity") of this Agreement including: (i) Aircraft Hull and Spares All Risks Insurances (including, to the extent usually available war and allied perils); and, (ii) Comprehensive General Third Party Legal Liability and Aircraft Passengers and Third Party Legal Liability Insurance in respect of incidents involving Aircraft to the extent usually available, having a Combined Single Limit of not less than [*****] any one occurrence; and, (iii) Employer's liability insurance; and, (iv) Repairer's values to be insured, including: - Lease of Stock (Exhibit 8 Clause 2.2) and Advanced Pool Service (Exhibit 15): the Items of the Stock shall be insured by theCompany under Spares All Risk Insurance for not less than the full replacement value; and, - Main Elements Service (Exhibit 11): each Spare Main Element to be delivered by the Repairer to the Company shall be insured by the Company, for not less than its full replacement value, under the Hull Insurance when installed on the Aircraft in addition to the agreed value of such Aircraft and under the Spares All Risk Insurance while in Stock prior to attachment or following removal and replacement from the Aircraft, including transportation to and from the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company shall maintain insurance, at its own costs and expenses, with insurers of recognized reputation acceptable to the Repairer, with respect to the undertakings of the Company in Clause 15 ("Liability and Indemnity") of this Agreement including: (i) Aircraft Hull and Spares All Risks Insurances; and, (ii) General Third Party Legal Liability and Aircraft Passengers and Third Party Legal Liability Insurance in respect of incidents involving Aircraft; and, (iii) Employer's liability insurance; and, (iv) Repairer's values to be insured, including: - Lease of Stock (Exhibit 8 Clause 2.2) and Advanced Pool Service (Exhibit 15): the Items of the Stock shall be insured by the Company under Spares All Risk Insurance; and, - Main Elements Service (Exhibit 11): each Spare Main Element to be delivered by the Repairer to the Company shall be insured by the Company under the Hull Insurance when installed on the Aircraft and under the Spares All Risk Insurance while in Stock prior to attachment or following removal and replacement from the Aircraft, including transportation to and from the Company.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the 'at all times during the Term', 'internationally recognized reputation reasonably acceptable to the Repairer', 'in accordance with industry standards', 'Comprehensive' from the liability insurance, and 'having a Combined Single Limit of not less than [*****] any one occurrence' weakens the insurance requirements. This creates a legal contradiction with Brazilian laws and international aviation standards that mandate specific insurance coverage levels for aircraft operations. This omission introduces significant legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Civil Aviation Regulations (RBAC), ICAO Annex 6

perturbation.original_text: 8.4 In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions and confirmation the policies shall not be cancelled or materially changed without [*****] prior written notice [*****] or such lesser period in respect of War and Allied Peril).
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4 In respect of all of the above insurances to contain breach or warranty provisions.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of the necessity to provide 'prior written notice' before cancellation or material change of the insurance policies. This introduces legal risk because it means the Repairer may not be notified before the insurance policies are cancelled.

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 At the latest upon the Signing Date, the Company shall provide the Repairer with relevant insurance certificates, in English, evidencing insurance requirements of this Clause 8, in a form reasonably acceptable to the Repairer, to be attached to this Agreement in the Exhibit 17 ("Insurance certificates"). Upon each renewal of the relevant insurance policies, the Company shall on reasonable request provide the Repairer with relevant insurance certificates in order to evidence insurance is maintained in accordance with this Clause 8. The Company also agrees to promptly pay each premium in respect of the aforesaid insurances and in the event of its failure to take out or maintain any such insurance then, without prejudice to any other rights it may have in respect of such failure, the Repairer may do so in its place and recover the cost of doing so from the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 At the latest upon the Signing Date, the Company may provide the Repairer with relevant insurance certificates evidencing insurance requirements of this Clause 8. The Company agrees to pay each premium in respect of the aforesaid insurances.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit requirements for insurance certificates 'in English', 'in a form reasonably acceptable to the Repairer', 'to be attached to this Agreement in the Exhibit 17', and the clause related to renewal requirements, the contract becomes less enforceable.
